title.value: In-Processing fairness improvement methods for regression Data-Driven building Models: Achieving uniform energy prediction
title.justification: The title clearly indicates the main focus of the paper, which is on improving fairness in regression data-driven models for energy prediction in buildings.
title.quote: In-Processing fairness improvement methods for regression Data-Driven building Models: Achieving uniform energy prediction

extractions.description: The paper discusses the development of in-processing methods to enhance predictive fairness in regression models for energy prediction in buildings. The authors propose four specific methods to achieve uniform energy prediction across various conditions, addressing fairness and accuracy trade-offs.

type.justification: The paper involves proposing new methods and applying them in a case study for linear regression models for energy prediction.
type.quote: Then, these proposed methods are applied to develop linear regression models for energy prediction of an apartment. In this case study, improving predictive fairness means to let the energy predictive accuracy be uniform no matter if there is occupancy movement.

name.justification: The paper focuses on methods for improving fairness in energy prediction models within the domain of building energy management.
name.quote: to develop linear regression models for energy prediction of an apartment

name.justification: The study addresses fairness in regression models specifically for building energy prediction.
name.quote: To improve the predictive fairness of regression models in terms of having similar predictive performance between different conditions, this study proposes four in-processing methods

name.justification: The models can be integrated into building energy management systems for optimal control and energy savings.
name.quote: energy prediction models could be integrated into model predictive controller to provide optimal control signals for building energy management systems to achieve energy saving, cost saving, and/or peak shifting

name.justification: The MRDP Regression is specifically introduced in the paper as one of the in-processing methods for improving fairness in regression models.
name.quote: four in-processing methods, namely mean residual difference penalized (MRDP) regression

is_contributed.justification: The MRDP regression is one of the novel methods proposed by the authors in this study.
is_contributed.quote: four in-processing methods, namely mean residual difference penalized (MRDP) regression...

is_executed.justification: The proposed method was applied to develop linear regression models in their case study.
is_executed.quote: Then, these proposed methods are applied to develop linear regression models for energy prediction of an apartment.

is_compared.justification: MRDP was compared with other methods like MSEC, MSEP, and MRDC in terms of effectiveness in improving predictive fairness.
is_compared.quote: MSEC is the most powerful method to improve fairness... MRDC is effective on improving the similarity of absolute mean residual difference ... however, MRDP would not affect the predictive result.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper itself introduces this model, so no external reference is needed.
referenced_paper_title.quote: four in-processing methods, namely mean residual difference penalized (MRDP) regression

name.justification: The MSEP Regression method is introduced in the paper as part of the new in-processing methods for fairness improvement.
name.quote: four in-processing methods, namely ..., mean square error penalized (MSEP) regression

is_contributed.justification: The MSEP regression is developed by the authors as a solution to improve regression fairness.
is_contributed.quote: four in-processing methods, namely ..., mean square error penalized (MSEP) regression,...

is_executed.justification: This method was implemented and tested alongside other proposed methods for energy prediction.
is_executed.quote: Then, these proposed methods are applied to develop linear regression models for energy prediction of an apartment.

is_compared.justification: MSEP is compared with MSEC and other methods regarding its impact on model fairness and accuracy.
is_compared.quote: ...while MSEP is another good option to improve fairness without a significant decrease on the overall accuracy.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper introduces this model method, hence it isn't based on an external existing model or reference.
referenced_paper_title.quote: four in-processing methods, namely ..., mean square error penalized (MSEP) regression...

name.justification: This is one of the four new methods proposed to improve fairness in energy prediction models for buildings.
name.quote: four in-processing methods, namely ..., mean residual difference constrained (MRDC) regression

is_contributed.justification: MRDC regression is one of the new methods introduced by the authors for enhancing predictive fairness.
is_contributed.quote: four in-processing methods, namely ..., mean residual difference constrained (MRDC) regression,...

is_executed.justification: These methods were executed in the case study for comparison and evaluation.
is_executed.quote: Then, these proposed methods are applied to develop linear regression models for energy prediction of an apartment.

is_compared.justification: MRDC was evaluated against other proposed methods for its effectiveness in predictive fairness.
is_compared.quote: MRDC is effective on improving the similarity of absolute mean residual difference (abs(MRD)) between different conditions

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper refers to its own developed model, thus no external reference title is needed.
referenced_paper_title.quote: four in-processing methods, namely ..., mean residual difference constrained (MRDC) regression...

name.justification: MSEC Regression is highlighted as the most powerful method for improving fairness among the discussed methods.
name.quote: four in-processing methods, namely ..., mean square error constrained (MSEC) regression

is_contributed.justification: MSEC is specifically crafted by the authors as a method to enhance fairness in regression.
is_contributed.quote: four in-processing methods, namely ..., mean square error constrained (MSEC) regression...

is_executed.justification: Method execution is implied through the context that it was part of the applied case study methods.
is_executed.quote: Then, these proposed methods are applied to develop linear regression models for energy prediction of an apartment.

is_compared.justification: MSEC's performance and impact on improving fairness were compared to other methods within the paper.
is_compared.quote: The result shows that MSEC is the most powerful method to improve fairness in terms of mean square error (MSE) rate...

referenced_paper_title.justification: This method is a contribution by the authors themselves, implying no external paper reference.
referenced_paper_title.quote: four in-processing methods, namely ..., mean square error constrained (MSEC) regression...
